alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 6:48AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Floyd and Pike. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 648 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pikeville, Coal Run Village, Elkhorn City, Wheelwright, Garden Village, Chloe, Shelbiana, Marrowbone, Raccoon, Fishtrap Lake, Rockhouse, Zebulon, Belcher, Lookout, Phyllis, Kimper, Cedarville, Coal Run, Virgie and Jonancy. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
